page.title: 02The Bridgewater Canal.
page.content: The canal was built in{1760,}but it has changed a lot since then. The old warehouses have become camping shops, engineering companies etc. The canal is only used by pleasure craft now, and we have a hire boat company at Agden Wharf. They have a trip boat and a restaurant boat. The canal is full of wildlife with wildflowers such as buttercups and birds such as a female mallard and her brood and a coot with her brood. We have a lot of fishermen on the canal, but we also saw some dead fish.The houses are in clumps facing onto the canal.One of the large houses belonged to one of the managers who built the canal.On the bridges we can see where the ropes which were attached to the horses who pulled the boats have rubbed against the walls and eroded the bricks.
